searchengine

Class TFScoreTest

  • java.lang.Object
    • searchengine.TFScoreTest

  • public class TFScoreTest
extends java.lang.Object
    Test how the TFScore is able score and rank various searches. First adding Website objects into a local ArrayList sites, and HashMap siteMap, with a URL, title and a random number of words. Then there are performed five tests. 1. Test the score on a single word, on a siteMap Throws NullPointerException, and are expected to handle it, since a Null-object is added to the map. 2. Test the score on a single word, on Tiny-databse. 3. Test the score on a single word, on a test-file. 4. Test whether the system is able to detect and catch IndexOutOfBoundsExceptions. 5. Testing the sorter method from QueryHandler, is able to sort based on the value, which is calculated by getScore() from TFIDF.

    • Method Detail

      • setUp

        public void setUp()
        Adds objects into map. Mixed sequence to make sure, that map is not returned in order they are added into the map. Key = Website Value = Score for a given query word, Website, and Index If Website contains words that are not the query the score will be 0.

      • tearDown

        @AfterEach
public void tearDown()

      • testSingleWordScore

        public void testSingleWordScore()
        Test getScore() from TFScore. Tests whether the calculated score for a given query, match the exact no. of occurrences in the map.

      • testSingleWordScoreDB

        public void testSingleWordScoreDB()
        Test getScore() from TFScore. Tests whether the calculated score for a given query, match the exact no. of occurrences in Tiny-database.

      • testSingleWordScoreTF

        public void testSingleWordScoreTF()
        Test getScore() from TFScore. Tests whether the calculated score for a given query, match the exact no. of occurrences in test-file.

      • testIndexOutOfBounds

        public void testIndexOutOfBounds()
        Tests getScore on tiny-database and local test-file. Throws IndexOutOfBoundsException which are expected to be caught since there is no index "100", and index "10".

      • testSorterMethodSingleWord

        public void testSorterMethodSingleWord()
